comments.body: Why `element` and `parent` parameters typed as `any`? As I can understand there is `RestangularElement` type exists. Is it different to parameter type?

element will be potentially an arbitrary piece of data, once you restangularize it, its then a RestangularElement.
i havent really used parent yet. i guess it could be a RestangularElement.
Just looked at sources and tests. Looks like you right. Great!
@vvakame is `string` correct type for `id`, shouldn't this be `number` ?

It depends on the application you're working with. Often times its number
but with several Microsoft applications such as SharePoint and Dynamics CRM
the id is actually a string formed GUID. Maybe using type of any would be
better here to accommodate more endpoints?

On Mon, May 23, 2016, 6:45 AM Blaz notifications@github.com wrote:

> In restangular/restangular.d.ts
> https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/9240#discussion_r64202149
> :
> 
> > @@ -116,6 +116,9 @@ declare namespace restangular {
> >      withHttpConfig(httpConfig: angular.IRequestShortcutConfig): IElement;
> >      save(queryParams?: any, headers?: any): IPromise<any>;
> >      getRestangularUrl(): string;
> > -    route?: string;
> > -    id?: string;
> 
> @vvakame https://github.com/vvakame is string correct type for id,
> shouldn't this be number ?
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/9240/files/83dcde9de2c6259aeafab1c0c68929bea0f95a2d#r64202149

> Maybe using type of any would be
> better here to accommodate more endpoints?

If it can be an object then I guess `any` is fine, otherwise we can use string or number `id?: string | number;`

Yeah that would be a better approach, I don't see a case that it would be
an object.

> In restangular/restangular.d.ts
> https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/9240#discussion_r64597763
> :
> 
> > @@ -116,6 +116,9 @@ declare namespace restangular {
> >      withHttpConfig(httpConfig: angular.IRequestShortcutConfig): IElement;
> >      save(queryParams?: any, headers?: any): IPromise<any>;
> >      getRestangularUrl(): string;
> > -    route?: string;
> > -    id?: string;
> 
> Maybe using type of any would be
> better here to accommodate more endpoints?
> 
> If it can be an object then I guess any is fine, otherwise we can use
> string or number id?: string | number;

> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/9240/files/83dcde9de2c6259aeafab1c0c68929bea0f95a2d#r64597763
It was not changed to support `number`, while you seems to agree it should. I am making a PR (https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/25248)
